title: A Good Life
body:
The Twin Drivers of a Good Life

The twin drivers of a good life: what you do and who you do it with.

Do what makes your soul sing. What lifts your spirit. What makes you feel alive.

Sure, there's no single activity that doesn't wear thin over time. That's why it's important to have a good mix.

David Eagleman calls it the "lazy susan" method of doing. As soon as an activity loses your interest, toggle to another. As long as the activty is one of your true interests, you will eventually return to it (usually in short order, after a good night's sleep). Life should be easy. If it's hard, then you're trying to force something. You're doing it wrong.

What you're good at will come naturally to you. Don't be judgmental and embrace your natural gravity.

Everyone possesses a natural gravity: a particular way of being that makes you feel light, free, and happy. Embrace it.

Who you live life withâ€” that's the "copilot question" from Up in the Air when George Clooney gives his famous speed to Danny McBride:

Life is long.

Go through it with the right person. Do what you enjoy. Everything else is downstream.
